summary: This document is a request for text to be inscribed on plaques to be awarded to individuals involved in the prosecutions of Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein. It expresses gratitude from the FBI/NYPD Child Exploitation and Human Trafficking Task Force for their work in pursuing justice and amplifying victims' voices.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as a defendant in the case 'United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell' for which the plaques are being created.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as a defendant in the case 'United States v. Jeffrey Epstein' for which the plaques are being created.

keyFacts: Plaques are being created to honor the work on the prosecutions of Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein.
The plaques are from the FBI/NYPD Child Exploitation and Human Trafficking Task Force, indicating inter-agency collaboration.
The text emphasizes the pursuit of justice and ensuring victims' voices were amplified, not forgotten.
The document is dated June 16, 2022, which is after the convictions of both Epstein and Maxwell.
The plaques are intended for an AUSA (Assistant United States Attorney) and a paralegal, though their specific names are not provided in the text.
